instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan spinning full
threads.message:
No visible sign of spillage. I ran hw monitor and only airport proximity sensor reading high. Diagnostics only says problem with fan. I tried 2 different chassis and both the same.
Any ideas welcome.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan spinning full
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan spinning full
threads.message: HI thanks for the reply. I found a resistor missing <RESISTOR>R6001</RESISTOR> so replaced it but fan still running full. I also noticed that the webcam turns on but black screen. Would this cause the fan to run high?.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan spinning full
threads.message:
Disconnect internal LCD and test with external monitor.
ALS issue can make the fan spins fast.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan spinning full
threads.message: I disconnected the internal lcd and hooked it up to external monitor but fan still runs fast.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan spinning full
threads.message:
May have other damaged component, or broken trace.
Compare readings between <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50 fan channels.
Try swapping both transistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan spinning full
threads.message: HI I swapped over both <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50 and fan stopped spinning fast . Must have been a bad connection on <TRANSISTOR>Q6050</TRANSISTOR>. Many thanks for your help.
